actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned pursuant to H. Res. 191. The next meeting is scheduled for 9:00 a.m. on March 6, 2025.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Newhouse moved that the House do now adjourn.
Mr. Newhouse asked unanimous consent that when the House adjourns today, it adjourn to meet at 9:00 a.m. on March 6. Agreed to without objection.

At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 189, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the resolution and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. McGovern demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 189.

actions-list.header: On motion to table Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 209
actions-list.actionItem: 211, 1 Present (Roll no. 60).
Ms. Clark (MA) moved to table the measure.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 189 — "Censuring Representative Al Green of Texas."

actions-list.header: QUESTION OF THE PRIVILEGES OF THE HOUSE
actions-list.actionItem: Mr. Newhouse rose to a question of the privileges of the House and offered the resolution. The Chair directed the Clerk to report the resolution. Upon examination of the resolution, the Chair determined that the resolution did constitute a question of the privileges of the House.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 222
actions-list.actionItem: 203 (Roll no. 59).

Considered as unfinished business. H.J. Res. 42 — "Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Department of Energy relating to "Energy Conservation Program for Appliance Standards: Certification Requirements, Labeling Requirements, and Enforcement Provisions for Certain Consumer Products and Commercial Equipment"."
The House observed a moment of silence in remembrance of the Honorable Sylvester Turner.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 216
actions-list.actionItem: 202 (Roll no. 58).

Considered as unfinished business. H.J. Res. 61 — "Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Environmental Protection Agency relating to "National Emission Standards for Hazardous Air Pollutants: Rubber Tire Manufacturing"."
The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on passage of H.J. Res. 61 and H.J. Res. 42 which were debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 191 — "Expressing the profound sorrow of the House of Representatives on the death of the Honorable Sylvester Turner."
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of March 5.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

At the conclusion of debate on H.J. Res. 42, the Chair put the question on passage of the joint resolution and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Pallone demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.J. Res. 42.

Rule provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 42, H.J. Res. 61 and S.J. Res. 11. The resolution provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 42, H.J. Res. 61, and S.J. Res. 11 under a closed rule with one of general debate on each measure. The resolution also provides for one motion to recommit on H.J. Res. 42 and H.J. Res. 61 and one motion to commit on S.J. Res. 11.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 177. H.J. Res. 42 — "Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Department of Energy relating to "Energy Conservation Program for Appliance Standards: Certification Requirements, Labeling Requirements, and Enforcement Provisions for Certain Consumer Products and Commercial Equipment"."

At the conclusion of debate on H.J. Res. 61, the Chair put the question on passage of the joint resolution and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Pallone demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.J. Res. 61.

Rule provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 42, H.J. Res. 61 and S.J. Res. 11. The resolution provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 42, H.J. Res. 61, and S.J. Res. 11 under a closed rule with one of general debate on each measure. The resolution also provides for one motion to recommit on H.J. Res. 42 and H.J. Res. 61 and one motion to commit on S.J. Res. 11.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 177. H.J. Res. 61 — "Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Environmental Protection Agency relating to "National Emission Standards for Hazardous Air Pollutants: Rubber Tire Manufacturing"."

actions-list.header: NOTIFICATION OF INTENT TO OFFER RESOLUTION
actions-list.actionItem: Mr. Newhouse notified the House of his intent to offer a privileged resolution pursuant to clause 2(a)(1) of rule IX. The Chair announced that a determination will be made at the time designated for consideration of the resolution.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.

actions-list.header: ADJUSTMENT OF THE WHOLE NUMBER OF THE HOUSE
actions-list.actionItem: Under clause 5(d) of rule XX, the Chair announced to the House that, in light of the death of the gentleman from Texas, Mr. Turner, the whole number of the House is 432.
The Chair designated Mr. Wilson of SC to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of March 5.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Mary E. Miller to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
